page.title: 01St Leonards Forest
page.content: Customs/Folk Lore and Traditions In a three to four mile compass around the town of Horsham, which lies near the western edge of the forest,there was, alledgedly in the middle ages, a dragon or Serpent of about 9ft in length with scales in his back and under belly, who by his poisonous venom, killed the inhabitants of his Kingdom He was often seen around the village of Faygate and three of the villagers swore to have personally to have seen the Fearful Beast and were very much afraid, so terrified were many of the inhabitants of the Forest in that area they would not go out alone by day or night for fear of an Encounter. St Leonard on hearing of this danger came to kill the Dragon with his sword where the blood fell the lilies turned pink.. so legend goes
